snippet: Ariel Morales, 26, had a passion for filmmaking and a full ride at Hampshire College, But when schizophrenia derailed his studies, he found a new path forward in urban farming.
abstract: Community Service Society of New York, one of the organizations supported by The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund, donates $303.70 to help Ariel Morales, who suffers from schizophrenia, buy food and $112 for monthly MetroCard which allows him to travel to training for Green City Force and to therapy.
lead_paragraph: Ariel Morales, 26, had a passion for filmmaking and a full ride at Hampshire College, But when schizophrenia derailed his studies, he found a new path forward in urban farming.

headline.print_headline: Sidetracked by Schizophrenia, a Former Film Student Plots a New Path
headline.main: Sidetracked by Schizophrenia, a Former Film Student Plots a New Path
